class.name: Word.Window
class.description: Represents the window that displays the document. A window can be split to contain multiple reading panes.

properties.name: activePane
properties.description: Gets the active pane in the window.

properties.name: areRulersDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether rulers are displayed for the window or pane.

properties.name: areScreenTipsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether comments, footnotes, endnotes, and hyperlinks are displayed as tips.

properties.name: areThumbnailsDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether thumbnail images of the pages in a document are displayed along the left side of the Microsoft Word document window.

properties.name: caption
properties.description: Specifies the caption text for the window that is displayed in the title bar of the document or application window.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Specifies the height of the window (in points).

properties.name: horizontalPercentScrolled
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal scroll position as a percentage of the document width.

properties.name: imemode
properties.description: Specifies the default start-up mode for the Japanese Input Method Editor (IME).

properties.name: index
properties.description: Gets the position of an item in a collection.

properties.name: isActive
properties.description: Specifies whether the window is active.

properties.name: isDocumentMapVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether the document map is visible.

properties.name: isEnvelopeVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether the email message header is visible in the document window. The default value is False.

properties.name: isHorizontalScrollBarDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether a horizontal scroll bar is displayed for the window.

properties.name: isLeftScrollBarDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether the vertical scroll bar appears on the left side of the document window.

properties.name: isRightRulerDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether the vertical ruler appears on the right side of the document window in print layout view.

properties.name: isSplit
properties.description: Specifies whether the window is split into multiple panes.

properties.name: isVerticalRulerDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether a vertical ruler is displayed for the window or pane.

properties.name: isVerticalScrollBarDisplayed
properties.description: Specifies whether a vertical scroll bar is displayed for the window.

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether the window is visible.

properties.name: left
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal position of the window, measured in points.

properties.name: next
properties.description: Gets the next document window in the collection of open document windows.

properties.name: panes
properties.description: Gets the collection of panes in the window.

properties.name: previous
properties.description: Gets the previous document window in the collection open document windows.

properties.name: showSourceDocuments
properties.description: Specifies how Microsoft Word displays source documents after a compare and merge process.

properties.name: splitVertical
properties.description: Specifies the vertical split percentage for the window.

properties.name: styleAreaWidth
properties.description: Specifies the width of the style area in points.

properties.name: top
properties.description: Specifies the vertical position of the document window, in points.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Gets the window type.

properties.name: usableHeight
properties.description: Gets the height (in points) of the active working area in the document window.

properties.name: usableWidth
properties.description: Gets the width (in points) of the active working area in the document window.

properties.name: verticalPercentScrolled
properties.description: Specifies the vertical scroll position as a percentage of the document length.

properties.name: view
properties.description: Gets the View object that represents the view for the window.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Specifies the width of the document window, in points.

properties.name: windowNumber
properties.description: Gets an integer that represents the position of the window.

properties.name: windowState
properties.description: Specifies the state of the document window or task window.

params.name: options
params.description: The options that define whether to save changes before closing and whether to route the document.

methods.name: largeScroll
methods.description: Scrolls the window by the specified number of screens.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for scrolling the window by the specified number of screens. If no options are specified, the window is scrolled down one screen.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: pageScroll
methods.description: Scrolls through the window page by page.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for scrolling through the window page by page.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: setFocus
methods.description: Sets the focus of the document window to the body of an email message.

methods.name: smallScroll
methods.description: Scrolls the window by the specified number of lines. A "line" corresponds to the distance scrolled by clicking the scroll arrow on the scroll bar once.

params.name: options
params.description: The options for scrolling the window by the specified number of lines. If no options are specified, the window is scrolled down by one line.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.Window object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.WindowData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
